parts.text:
```json
{
"application": "SLURM",
"details": {
"software": [
"Anaconda3/2022.05",
"PyTorch/1.12.0-foss-2022a-CUDA-11.7.0",
"python"
],
"resources": {
"partition": "gpu",
"nodes": 1,
"gpus": 1,
"time": "08:00:00",
"memory": "32G",
"output": "slurm/outputs/train_%A.out",
"scratch_space": "$TMPDIR"
},
"script": "run/main.py",
"arguments": [
"tune",
"t5",
"generate",
"--basedir",
"msc/msc_personasummary/",
"--sessions",
"2",
"3",
"--train_samples",
"10000",
"--valid_samples",
"2000",
"--batch_size",
"48",
"--learning_rate",
"0.0003",
"--epochs",
"1",
"--valid_interval",
"10",
"--patience",
"4",
"--device",
"cuda",
"--loglevel",
"INFO",
"--logdir",
"$TMPDIR/logs/",
"--datadir",
"$TMPDIR/data/",
"--output_dir",
"$TMPDIR/output/",
"--experiment_name",
"t5_tokens_s23"
]
}
}
```

This script runs a job on a SLURM cluster. It uses a GPU partition and requires 1 node with 1 GPU. The job runs for a maximum of 8 hours and uses 32 GB of RAM. The script outputs to the "slurm/outputs" directory. 

The script loads the Anaconda3/2022.05 and PyTorch/1.12.0-foss-2022a-CUDA-11.7.0 modules. It then runs a Python script called "run/main.py" with the arguments specified in the script. The script performs tuning of a T5 model for text generation with specific parameters. It copies the data directory to the scratch space and logs output to the specified directory. Finally, it copies the logs and output from the scratch space to the permanent location.
